Package com.ezasm.simulation

Class Memory

java.lang.Object
com.ezasm.simulation.Memory
public class Memory extends Object
Represents the system memory. There will be a single and contiguous array of memory which represents both the stack and heap with the stack growing downward and the heap growing upward. Implements an "offset" for the address spacing to not start at 0. Keeps track of allocated memory and throws an exception when the heap crosses the stack. Has a default size of 2^16 words (or 2^19 bytes). Has a default word size of 8 bytes (the typical long integer or long float size).

    • allocate

      public int allocate(int bytes, int sp)
      Allocates a certain number of bytes with a check based on stack pointer to ensure that the heap pointer does not cross the stack pointer.
      Parameters:
      bytes - the number of bytes to allocate.
      sp - the current stack pointer of the program.
      Returns:
      the allocated memory starting point
